panels.content:
# Intro

This dashboard consists of examples used in a series of blog posts on how to build dashboards with VMware vSphere Performance data.

The datasource is an InfluxDB database with metrics pulled by the vSphere input plugin for the Telegraf agent.

For more information check out the [blog series](https://rudimartinsen.com/vsphere-performance-vol2)

targets.query: SELECT count(distinct("esxhostname")) FROM (SELECT "usage_average", "esxhostname" FROM "vsphere_host_cpu" WHERE ("clustername" = 'vsan-01') AND $timeFilter)
SELECT count(distinct("vmname")) FROM (SELECT "usage_average", "vmname" FROM "vsphere_vm_cpu" WHERE ("clustername" = 'vsan-01') AND $timeFilter)

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY = "vmname" WHERE "esxhostname" =~ /$host/
list.label: VM
list.name: vm
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY = "vmname" WHERE "esxhostname" =~ /$host/
